Operation 'post_/api/pricing-hub/prices' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary 'Retrieve prices' is too generic and doesn't convey the full operation scope. Description lacks clarity on inputs (cart items, customer context), outputs (pricing data structure), and the selection mechanism for pricing methods. Enhanced version specifies that this is a calculation operation, clarifies the request/response nature, explains the method selection process, and maintains the deprecation warning while being more actionable for AI agents.

data.current_description:
>⚠️ This API has been deprecated. If you need to associate prices with specific customers, we recommend using the [Audience API](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/audience-api).
 
This route retrieves and applies prices for the items that are passed in the request. Pricing Hub will select the pricing method that will be used for each item and will fetch their respective price from the selected pricing method.
data.summary_suggestion: Calculate and retrieve prices for cart items
data.description_suggestion:
⚠️ **DEPRECATED** - Use the Audience API for customer-specific pricing instead.

Calculates and retrieves prices for items in a shopping cart by querying the configured external pricing system or internal pricing method. Accepts a request containing cart items with their details (SKU, quantity, customer context). Pricing Hub automatically selects the appropriate pricing method for each item and returns the calculated prices. The operation applies the external pricing system's tax rules and returns pricing data for all requested items.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Retrieve prices' is too generic and doesn't convey the full operation scope. Description lacks clarity on inputs (cart items, customer context), outputs (pricing data structure), and the selection mechanism for pricing methods. Enhanced version specifies that this is a calculation operation, clarifies the request/response nature, explains the method selection process, and maintains the deprecation warning while being more actionable for AI agents.

message: Operation 'ConfigExternalPriceSource' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and action-oriented, so no change needed. Description lacks specificity about what configuration parameters are required (endpoint, credentials), what the activation/deactivation effects are, and what the response contains. Enhanced version clarifies inputs (endpoint, credentials), explains the side effects (affects routing of pricing requests, immediate effect), specifies the scope (account-level), and describes the response nature for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
>⚠️ This API has been deprecated. If you need to associate prices with customers, we recommend using the [Audience API](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/audience-api).
 
This route facilitates setting up an external price source in Pricing Hub. It also allows you to activate or deactivate that source in a given account.
data.description_suggestion:
⚠️ **DEPRECATED** - Use the Audience API for customer-specific pricing instead.

Configures and manages an external price source for Pricing Hub in the specified account. Accepts configuration details including the external pricing system endpoint and authentication credentials. Enables or disables the external price source for the account, affecting how Pricing Hub routes pricing requests. Returns confirmation of the configuration update. Changes take effect immediately and apply to all subsequent pricing calculations in the account.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented, so no change needed. Description lacks specificity about what configuration parameters are required (endpoint, credentials), what the activation/deactivation effects are, and what the response contains. Enhanced version clarifies inputs (endpoint, credentials), explains the side effects (affects routing of pricing requests, immediate effect), specifies the scope (account-level), and describes the response nature for better AI agent understanding.
